intro: Echium lycopsis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a fuzzy texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Echium lycopsis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
